did.unittitle: Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway Company Work Agreements, Regulations, Wage Book and Book of Rules

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway Company

did.abstract: Work Agreements, Regulations, Wage Book and Book of Rules from Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway Company.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Wheeling & Lake Erie Railway Company [WLE] was a railroad that operated primarily in Ohio from 1871 to 1988. The railroad was designed to connect the coal fields around Wheeling, West Virginia with port cities on Lake Erie. In 1948, the WLE was leased to the Nickel Plate Road (New York, Chicago and St. Louis Railroad). In 1988, the WLE was merged into Norfolk and Western Railway.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of five pamphlets from the Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway Company describing Work Agreements, Regulations, Wage Rates and Rules.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

did.unittitle: Work Agreements, Regulations, Wage Book and Book of Rules from Wheeling and Lake Erie Railway Company
Item 1: Wheeling & Lake Erie Railway Co. Rules for the Government of the Transportation Department. Superseding Any Prior Orders or Instructions Inconsistent herewith. To take effect April 15, 1894.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Hadley & Hadley, Toledo, Ohio. 123 pages. Pamphlet signed out to J. E. Griswold, Agt., June 15, 1905.

did.unittitle: Item 2: The Wheeling & Lake Erie Railway Co. Schedule of Wages No. 5. Rules.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Ward & Shaw, Cleveland, Ohio. 8 pages. Signed "R. J. Jones."

did.unittitle: Item 3: The Wheeling & Lake Erie Railway Co. Schedule of Wages No. 5. Rules.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Ward & Shaw, Cleveland, Ohio. 8 pages.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Wheeling & Lake Erie R. R. Co. Wabash Pittsburgh Terminal Ry. Co. West Side Belt R. R. Co. Schedule for Train and Yardmen. Effective June 1, 1910.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 20 pages. Cover signed by "R. J. Jones."

did.unittitle: Item 5: The Wheeling & Lake Erie R. R. Co. The Wabash-Pittsburgh Terminal Ry. Co. The West Side Belt R. R. Co. Rates of Pay and Regulations Affecting Conductors, Trainmen and Yardmen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Award in arbitration between the Eastern Railroads and Order of Conductors and Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen. Effective October 1, 1913. 34 pages. Signature "Ray Huntsinger" on cover page.
